<JD_START>
Job Title: Partner Engagement Specialist

Location: Oregon, United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Consulting, Sales, Strategy/Planning

Description:
Do you want to be part of a transformative educational technology company? Do you want to help make a difference within the education space? Our client helps develop and accelerate the learning potential of all students, and teachers throughout the world – Join Us!
Job Summary:
The Partner Engagement Specialist works on a team of highly skilled professional development specialists as the pedagogical expert, developing and organizing professional development for prospective and current clients. They provide account support, leading the pilot process, and maintaining customer feedback loop to the organization.
Responsibilities:Demonstrate subject matter expertise in learning, presenting, and providing in-person and virtual trainings for pre-kindergarten through 12th grade Math, Science, ELA, and Social Studies.Provides a baseline of customer service and account management for current clients, building trust and credibility with teachers, staff, and district leaders.Deliver professional development trainings, and continually track renewals across product lines.Develop and execute sales support strategies from interest to renewal.Manage successful district Pilots, keeping an eye on maximizing Pilot to Adoption conversion.Define customer segmentation, strategies and support models and identify opportunities for continuous improvement.Support a culture centered on partner engagement and act as voice of customer to sales, marketing, and product teams.Work collaboratively alongside other internal teams including Customer Service, Account Executives, and other Professional Development teams.Travel to deliver high quality professional development sessions to schools and districts: 30-50% possible travel.Other duties as required.

Requirements/QualificationLocation  Northeast (NY,NJ,MD,DE,PA,NJ CT,MA,RI,ME) Northwest (OR, WA, WY, MT, ID)Bachelor’s degree in Education, Sales, Marketing, Account Management or relevant field, and a minimum of 5+ years of sales or account management experience; or an acceptable combination of education and experience.A Master’s Degree in Education, Educational Technology or a relevant field is preferred.Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite and CRM applications required; experience with Salesforce preferred.Must have experience and subject matter expertise in one or more Core subject/content areas.Ability to understand on-going market trends and align campaigns to relevant projects and programs.Knowledge of industry accepted best practices and tools.Strong multi-tasking, project management, and proactive problem-solving abilities.Exceptional communication skills with strong verbal, written, and presentation proficiency.Highly organized with a strong attention to detail and excellent follow-through.

Our client is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a diverse workforce, providing equal employment and advancement opportunities to all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, or any other protected status.
As a global leader in Recruitment Process Outsourcing (RPO), Mogel RPO provides full-service business talent solutions. We help companies around the world find, hire, and train people who share their sense of purpose for the work they do.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
